question: Which are the only two countries that share land borders with Ecuador?
explanation: Ecuador is a country located in northwestern South America bordered by only two countries such as Colombia to the north and Peru to the east and south. The Pacific Ocean is located to the west of Ecuador. The Galapagos Islands is under the administration of Ecuador. The capital of Ecuador is Quito. Quito, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is the second-highest official capital city in the world, after La Paz and the closest capital city to the equator located on the Guayllabamba river basin and on the eastern slope of Pichincha active stratovolcano. The United States Dollar is the official currency of Ecuador.
